desc: Notes from a course presented by T Gilb, an Agile coach, on Architectures & engineering tools in an Agile environment.  This article attempts to push an important and vast set of ideas and processes into text.

desc: Advanced Git notes and Git workflow on how to use it to solve practical problems with it, with extensive performance tips list which are omitted from general sites.

title: Improving React18 Performance

desc: When writing reusable UI components, ideas for how to manage CSS in them.  Most Apps will be built with a CSS framework, and this should be leveraged.
title: CSS organisation

desc: PART 1 about OSS and why OSS is important.  Read for demographic perspective and social effects.
title: OSS/GPL [pt1]

desc: Discussing the reasons for investing a month on rewriting old code (again).

desc: An article pulling up all the different technologies to access a Node interpreter via C++.
title: Linking libraries to NodeJS

desc: Research into how to be able to use JS modules in the browsers.
title: JS modules notes

desc: For app availability, my solution is to implement JS backchannel logging, this can enable limited-edition test / review editions better and faster for apps.  The article lists high-level requirements for this idea along with the requirements.
title: JS backchannel Logging

desc: A look at HTTP cache building in the webrowser, flush caching both on static assets.  I propose a feature to manage old and bad caches.
title: HTTP cache breaker

desc: A website should be written to support an audience or customers; many people use search tools to add themselves to that audience.  This article describes a categorisation scheme for your audiences.
title: Search utility

desc: Brief analysis on VOIP platforms from 2020 and 2022. I examine software selection metrics. A list details 7 VOIP platforms.

desc: Transport Layer Security is very niche. Finally TLS 1.0, a very old protocol, was removed from Windows, the last vendor who were using it. I discuss the TLS context, technical details and upgrades.

desc: Various and assorted notes imported from my phone from meetups I intended.
title: Assorted notes from meetups

desc: Filling a non-found manual for MIBs used in SNMP. This article is more narrow scope and abstract than most.  A List on how to make MIBs.
title: snmp-mibs manual

desc: Seven technical and orthogonal steps to suspend unneeded processes and features on laptops; which will make them quieter and make the battery charge last longer.
title: Laptop CPU management

desc: Investigation into how current technology for laptop batteries actually work, and how to maintain battery lifespan. A list of best handling practices is also included.
title: Laptop batteries

desc: Article to describe specifics on software design and the heuristic process of designing software.  I also analyse practical implementation.
title: Software design

desc: PHP design patterns and Structures that I apply & use are analysed in this article. I list over 18 Patterns I use.  Content is evergreen.
title: Design Patterns

desc: A list of miscellaneous tools, mostly for PHP, although they cover beyond PHP.
title: Misc Useful tools

desc: On text cleaning, and the algorithms necessary. Within the context of word filtering; I look at goals, requirements, and one example. I analyse the notion of word filtering also during the practice in 2012.
title: Word filtering

desc: DVCS or Distributed version control systems often include an automation engine, so business level transactions can be achieved via a single mouse click (git in your IDE).  This is a comparative review of the first 4 engines, and is a partial article todate.  I will extend this soonish.
title: DVCS

desc: People use images to communicate. This article lists improvements across three decades of image in casual usage on the net. Sample implementation of image requirements along with existing and current image widgets.
title: modal popover

desc: An introduction to my study on AI algorithms and structures.  Mentions other earlier product supported by AI features and some characteristics of LLM created text.
title: Intro for LLM

desc: LLM algorithms and RAG: how to build solutions with AI. I originally sought the info I present you here for about three days and it wasnt easy to find, even for me being a dev. Having this data in one easy access was needed and useful.
title: AI RAG coding

desc: A compilation of information about Vector searches, stores and Vector DB, along with Vector store recommendations.  The text has a focus on architectures and algorithms, so that, for these topics, the article remains relevant.
title: LLM / AI vectors

desc: A comprehensive list of algorithms for LLM-based AI and related technologies. Also includes definitions of each terms for AI context, and a list of 19 tuning algorithms to improve LLM.
title: Dictionary

desc: As LLMs are evolved rather than written, their testing is a different process to other software.  However, various reported and unexpected features show that testing is necessary.  The articles includes a LLM test plan and context information.
title: LLM testing

desc: Some data about Classifiers, the definition, when to use them, how to test them, and how they fit into ML and LLM.   Includes descriptions of 14 algorithms which are used to make the classifiers.
title: AI Classifiers

desc: A Focus on tools available to support test populations of prompts for AI/LLM products, and notes on why this is needed.  I outline a test-plan for a chatbot-based product as a sample.
title: Testing Prompts

desc: Conceptual analysis and discussion on how to make data, of data generation for testing via synthetic data, I also list a range of algorithmic options for generating data.
title: Synthetic

desc: A research and analysis of 12 techniques to fine-tune and improve an LLM in order to obtain a creative and generative product-making process.
title: Tune LLM

desc: This is an extended article on modal popover, this file contains improved graphic design, which matches visually other websites, however,  it is technically better.
title: Modal Popover

desc: Article outlining information about current stress-test tools, in a variety of platforms.   I examine the requirements for those tools and provide an comprehensive list of 8 tools.
title: REST test

desc: Project management for 6 festivals in 12 months, detailed one year planning and cost control. My festival holidays in 2010 are an example of project planning.   This is obviously personal, but was a well organised project.
title: Festivals 2010
